name: andromeda
content:
Andromeda noun
(PRINCESS)
Add to word list
Add to word list
in Greek mythology (= ancient stories), a princess who is tied to a rock to be eaten by a monster before being saved: The painting shows Perseus rescuing Andromeda. Perseus appears on Pegasus and frees Andromeda.
More examplesFewer examplesPerseus learns of Andromeda and her plight. The work is based on the Classical legend of Andromeda and Perseus.The statue of Thetis collapses and its head comes to life, demanding Andromeda as a virgin sacrifice to the Kraken in 30 days.

Andromeda noun
(STARS)
a large group of stars that can be seen in the northern hemisphere (= the half of the earth above the equator): The cloud finally clears and I pick out Andromeda. Just below the third star in Andromeda is the Triangulum Galaxy.
More examplesFewer examplesThe Horsehead Nebula is in Orion, not Andromeda.Stars were described as "the star in the right knee of Andromeda" or "the star in the left shoulder of Orion".Triangulum is a small but distinctive constellation between Aries and Andromeda.

Andromeda noun
(PLANT)
a plant that produces flowers, often found in soft wet ground: We found the Andromeda growing on the banks of a lagoon of fresh water. Andromeda is also known as bog rosemary.
Ruth Peterkin/iStock/Getty Images Plus/GettyImages
More examplesFewer examplesAll sorts of lilies and Andromeda were growing in the marsh.Andromeda flowers may be white or pinkish.Andromeda is often found in bogs.
